acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=14microg/L of the fish (Fathead Minnows) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) and others.).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 271mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 560mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), 164mg/kg, 238mg/kg, 335mg/kg, 562mg/kg, and 1,022mg/kg (EU-RAR No.7 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 7.9ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation of vapour) of 0.018mg/L (4 hours) (EHC 127 (1991)), 0.065mg/L (1 hour) (EU-RAR No.7 (2001)), and 20.8mg/L (4 hours) (EHC 127 (1991)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (361,000 ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 274mmHg (25degC) (equivalent to 36,500Pa at 25degC) (HSDB (2005)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 42mg/kg (DFGOT vol.16 (2001)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC (1995) and Category A4 by ACGIH (2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=-0.01(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by TOC: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gaseous substances are not available - boiling point: 53degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 55degC

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is -26degC (c.c.) and the boiling point is 53degC (ICSC, 2004), those containing stabilizers Class 3 and Division 6.1 (UN#1092) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests) and somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests) and the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No. 66, 2005.

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 234degC (ICSC,2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.66 (2005), CERI Hazard Data (2000) and MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 3 (2004): No adverse effects were observed (oral route). Although the results of rabbit/rat teratogenicity studies show adverse effects on the embryo, they are not used for evaluation purposes because they are based on intravenous and intra-amniotic administration.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 and Division 6.1 (UN#1092) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "irreversible effects on the eye" from the rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.66 (2005), EU-RAR No.7 (2001)), and the classification into Category 1 (skin corrosion and irritation).

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the human health effects ((EU-RAR No.7 (2001)) "erythema and severe edema associated with the formation of blisters. The results of biopsies (48 hours after the application of a 10% solution) indicate blisters, necrosis, inflammation, cellular infiltration and edema in the papillary layer in all cases," and the results of rabbit skin irritation tests, the substance is considered "corrosive" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.66 (2005), EU-RAR No.7 (2001), CICAD No.43 (2002)), although the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the results of guinea pig skin sensitization tests - all negative (EU-RAR No.7 (2001)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "chronic pneumonia, pulmonary emphysema, pulmonary/hepatic/renal inflammation, metaplasia or epithelial hyperplasia in the nasal and laryngeal squamous epithelium, bronchial/bronchiolar/alveolar inflammation" ((CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.66 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (respiratory system, nervous system, liver),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, nervous system, liver)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "right bronchial stenosis, edema and ecchymosis in the upper trachea, chronic bronchitis, pulmonary emphysema" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.66 (2005)), and the evidence from animal studies including "gait disorder, convulsions, decease" (CERI Hazard Data 96-46 (2000)), "respiratory irritation, moderate narcotic effects (recovery observed in few hours)" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), "acidophilic degeneration of hepatocytes associated with microvesicular steatosis" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.66 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
